en.text: Chen Shaoxiong (born 1962, Shantou) graduated from the Print Department of Guangzhou Academy of Fine Arts in 1984. A founding member of the Big Tail Elephant Group in 1990, Chen also works collaboratively with artists from different backgrounds, forming the collective Xijing Men with Tsuyoshi Ozawa and Gim Hongsok in 2007. He works with a variety of media including photography, video, installation, and ink painting to investigate the dynamics of China’s rapidly changing cityscapes. Chen lives and works in Beijing.

1984年畢業於廣州美術學院版畫系後，參與組建珠三角地區最早的概念藝術小組「大尾象工作組」。陳劭雄關注1990 年代以來中國南方地區快速發展的商業化和都市化，為居民日常生活和心理所帶來的刺激與變化，特別是都市生活中的時間、大眾媒介、都市景觀和社會政治。2006 年移居北京後，陳劭雄開始以水墨和錄像為主要創作媒介，用單張水墨摹畫日常生活的場景、示威抗議的政治活動、歷史事件的照片，然後編輯成動畫。他透過水墨、照片和錄像的轉換，探討個人記憶與客觀記錄的關係。

In 1984, Chen Shaoxiong graduated from the printmaking department at the Guangzhou Academy of Fine Arts.
He co-founded the Big Tail Elephant Group, the first conceptual art group in the Pearl River Delta. Chen was concerned with the rapid commercialisation and urbanisation of southern China that began in the 1990s, and how it impacted the residents’ daily lives and psychology.
He focused particularly on the passage of time, mass media, landscape, and sociopolitics of city life. After moving to Beijing in 2006, Chen began to create animations by combining ink painting with video art. He photographed individual ink paintings that depicted scenes of everyday
life, political protests, and historical incidents, and then sequenced them together into animations. Through ink, photography, and video, he explored the relationship between individual memories and objective records.

zh-hant.text: 陳劭雄 (1962年生於汕頭，現工作及生活於北京)，1984年畢業於廣州美術學院版畫系，於1990年參與創立「大尾象工作組」。他喜歡與不同背景的藝術家合作，並於2007年與小澤剛及金泓錫組成「西京人」。他的創作涉獵攝影、錄像、裝置、水墨畫等不同媒介，作品探視中國城市景觀瞬息萬變的動態。
